Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera! Perfect for both beginners and pros!
Reviews.Author: Obin C. Robinson "Obin Robinson"
Reviews.Content: We have owned (and still own) two other Pentax compact cameras: an Optio 60 and an Optio M20. We have fallen in love with the simplicity of the menus, the quality of the photos, and the incredible battery life of the E60. This camera is so intelligent and quick that it is simply amazing. Even low light pictures, macros, and photos of fast objects come out looking spectacular. This camera offers performance which you would have paid $300+ for only a year or two ago. The small size means it fits in shirt pockets or pants pockets easily. We don't even keep track of battery life because basic rechargeable AA batteries last a very long time in this camera. We are so thrilled with the Optio E60 and we can see this coming along on every vacation, to every party, and to every special event where a bulky camera is not needed.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: El Viajero "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I have a Pentax DSLR but was looking for an affordable compact digital. This one fits the bill. At 10MP it captures high quality images at an affordable price. It is a bit limited in its ability to allow manual adjustments but that is expected at this price point. It does have quite a few shooting modes that do a pretty good job. It drains my rechargeable AAs quicker than I would like but it is good to know that I can get batteries easily if I am ever in a jam. Overall it is a great, small-sized point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Point N shoot. Easy Menus. Great for novice. I love it.
Reviews.Author: Barely There "Never regret anything that made...
Reviews.Content: I'm a simple girl. I don't read instructions. Don't know jack about cameras. I bought this Pentax Optio E60, slapped in two rechargable AA batteries, put on the strap, carried some spare alkalines and took on vacation.Camera took great shots of my airplane...even zoom. I just pointed and shot. Got great photos between palm trees. I let auto focus do the trick.After 50 pictures and four days I have two out of three bars left on the rechargeable batteries. I turned the camera on only for brief periods ten times.For close up shots for this review (see pics if I can upload) I did play with the easy menu and tried flower/macro mode. I make jewelry so I wanted clear close up focus ability too.This small camera does exactly what I want.Transfer: I tried the camera Pc interface, nothing happened so I popped out the sdhc transcend card (which I bought for under ten bucks with reader) slid it into the card reader and easily had my pictures. The camera sorted the pictures into file folders by date.You have date options on the camera. It does have facial function if people are in the photos. Has a few more features.This is the LOW end of the camera line. The zoom retracts so this is a very small camera. Yet the buttons are placed so they are easy to see and use. The camera layout is great use of space. LCD screen is huge.Buttons easy to get to and to individually select and use.Camera feels solid.NOTE: I would NOT EVEN think of putting it into a purse without a cover. The camera lens has a cover but not the huge lcd.It does take sd HC cards. It uses AA batteries or rechargeables.  NOTE: A few have noted high battery consumption. Maybe it uses batteries up if you watch each picture, and play with menus a lot.Conclusion: I have had it one week and I'm very happy for a novice....that just wants zoom, close up and point and shoot.I bought this because:It does NOT have a proprietary lithium battery like the Sony Cybershot It does NOT use proprietary Sony memory Pro sticks.I want just want to point and shoot and not spend much money (I'm cheap).I wanted to use AA rechargeable batteries and SD HC card and easily transfer pictures without special software /hardware.This is a more expensive higher capacity version of the transcend sd hc card and reader I bought.Transcend 16 GB SDHC Class 6 Flash Memory Card with Card Reader TS16GSDHC6-S5W

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Ylette R. Colwell "Rozcraft"
Reviews.Content: FIRST I WILL TALK ABOUT MY FIRST PURCHASE-THE OLYMPUS FE-25 10MP CAMERA:I purchased this camera off e-bay factory-refurbished.  I love the look of this Olympus camera-very sleek and sophisticated.  But it was all show and not go.  I was told by the company that this camera recorded sound in movie mode.  I didn't see any speakers on this camera.  Just know this beforehand.  This one issue was not a deal breaker for me because I mainly bought the camera for taking pics.  The main issue for me was looking at the LCD screen.  The images looked slightly grainy/fuzzy for a 10mp camera.  Also, I took this camera into the store and compared it to other 10mp cameras (Canon, Nikon, Kodak, Fujifilm, and other Olympus fes) and noticed a yellow/dull tint in the LCD screen in comparison.  Imagine looking at the world with slightly colored amber glasses.  That's what this LCD screen was like!  But I am not electronics savvy, so I waited until I could print the shots to see the print quality.  The pictures printed slighty fuzzy-not the quality I would expect from a 10mp camera.  I contacted the warranty department and they questioned whether I had it at a high enough ISO or whether I had set it to the right mode.  But high ISO settings didn't change this.  The customer service was sluggish to switch the camera but offered to look at it and repair it if need be.  But I decided on another camera.  I thought that problems with this camera was because it was a refurb, until I read other reviews that a blurriness was a problem with this camera.  A few people have reviewed the Fe-25 as taking good pictures.  I don't know which is true, I just know what happened with my camera, but I will stress that it was a REFURB.NOW FOR THE PENTAX OPTIO E60:I ended up looking at the Pentax Optio E60.  It is 10mp with a clear sharp LCD screen and when I uploaded pics onto my PC they were so clear compared to the Olympuse FE-25.  My final choice was between this one and the Nikon L18.  I even liked the look, feel, and performance of the Pentax.  One plus about the Nikon was that the LCD screen (3 inch) is really large compared to the Pentax (2.4 inch) and I liked that feature, but I can see just fine with the Pentax and I can be confident that I will get a quality picture! The Olympus Fe-25 camera ate my batteries up after the first 50 pictures!  The Pentax will last through about 150-200 pictures; and 3X that with two AA lithium batteries. Don't be fooled by the marketing or big names; because they may represent both great and also mediocre performers.  I was not as familiar with the Pentax products or their history when I bought this camera; but if you are looking for quality pictures and features that are easy to use this is definately the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Alisa Gantt
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos even in less-than-optimal conditions and it's very simple to use. Easy menus allow you to make manual adjustments or the automaic setting will take care of everything for you. We love it!

Reviews.Title: great, easy to use, inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: D. Richardson "thegirliestgirl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Pentax camera on a whim just before a recent trip to Vegas.  I got great shots of all the main Vegas area landmarks, day and night.  I found the camera small, lightweight, comfortable, and so easy to use, I was able to figure out everything I needed w/o reading any directions.  Did the basic menu set-up, installed batteries and SD card, turned it on, and began taking pictures.  I found it much easier to use than my last two Kodak digital cameras, which were both much more expensive, even considering how far costs for electronics have come down.  Don't know if this is the standard package, but my camera came with software, batteries, strap, small case, USB and AV cables.I debated deducting a point but decided not to because although it used the first set of batteries really fast, this last pair has lasted a little while (lithium).  So, I would say buy rechargeables and keep spares.  I would rate it as a small inconvenience at this level of value.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: M. TRIEU
Reviews.Content: This camera is a piece of s#%t. I received it from a lottery win the day before I left for a road trip and had problems after problems throughout the trip. On the first rest stop, the view finder stopped working after of couple of shots. It stopped working after I put the camera in my pocket while it was still on, but it wasn't treated rough. I could take pictures and can preview it after taking the picture, but didn't know what I was taking pictures of as the view finder was just black. After playing with settings, I managed to fix it, but after a few more pictures, it gave me several different Lens Errors - 0x15110000, 0x01110000... First it wasn't able to get the lens to come out when turned on, then it automatically shuts off. I managed to get that fixed somehow, now I have another lens error, where the lens is stuck out.Have been using new Energizer NiMH batteries. It's not the batteries, because they work in my Canon S3. My battery tester still tells me that the batteries still have a high charge.

Reviews.Title: Awesome DC!!
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon D40, two Panasonic Lumix DCs, an HP DC, but the Pentax E60 DC performs the best overall. Ideal night scene mode for low light shootings, extra ISO helps a lot. I'll buy a Pentax DSLR next time.

Reviews.Title: Very Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Teller
Reviews.Content: As a very amateur photographer I love this camera. Very Easy to Use, inside the house well lighted area pictures are very sharp. What amazed me was that landscape photos with the Panorama mode on turned out far nicer than I expected. And night photos with the flash were surprisingly good too. It's very small and easy to carry about, though I got a nice leather, cloth lined case for it -- the nylon one provided seemed a bit flimsy and I was worried about it scratching the LCD. The camera package I was sent had very obviously been already opened and repackaged which was disappointing -- but everything was there in tip top shape and working great.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph Johnson "RGJ"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera. Easy to use and sharp picture quality. Very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: staff coming with the product
Reviews.Author: Cansu Kandemir
Reviews.Content: great product with corel photoshop in the pockete. easy to use, images are so clear and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: S. Weisser
Reviews.Content: I have taken outside photos that have great color. Inside not so much.Eats AA batteries. My little Canon will take hundreds of photos on a charge.This one needs rechargeables or it will break you.The Optio is a light and simple pocket camera, but it's not a star.

Reviews.Title: Great Color Saturation
Reviews.Author: Robert Therina
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2 years and have taken it with me on beach vacations. I set the scenery to beach view and get great color saturation of the turquoise and emerald water of the Florida panhandle area. I post pictures on Flickr and have had some picked up by people wanting to use them for publications. Obviously, only having the LCD display can make it difficult to view your scene in bright light. The camera does suck down the AA batteries pretty quick, so you will want to turn it off if you expect any appreciable time between taking pictures. For this camera, I bring about 8 rechargeable AA's which is more than enough for a full day, but extra in case I forget to charge some overnight. I had bought it for around $120, and all in all, this is a very good camera for that price.

Reviews.Title: Broke after several uses
Reviews.Author: Lynn Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son. He only got to use iy a couple of times before it stopped taking pictures. screen would be WHITE. You could view old pics but anu new pics would just be blank. He was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: It was good while it lasted...
Reviews.Author: Crystal Eller
Reviews.Content: Excepting it's undying thirst for batteries, I enjoyed this camera.  It was a Pentax (which I like), wasn't overpriced, easy to use/change modes, had nice photo quality and gave me the extra zoom power I was wanting.  I used it very lightly, and had no problems.However, I just took it on vacation -- only half a day in, with heavy camera usage, it errored out.  The lens froze in place and the camera turned off.  Now every time I turn it on, I receive a Lens Error.A google search shows that many other people have the same issue.  From what I've read online, the necessary fix is to have it serviced by a professional (or buy a different camera).  I don't know how expensive that would be, but I am doubting it would be very cost effective.It was annoying enough having to lug around a giant pack of AA's, but I grudgingly accepted that.  Now I can't use it at all...  My recommendation is to search elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: not recommended
Reviews.Author: James Lawson
Reviews.Content: Pros: light weight, inexpensiveCons: Pictures quality is blurry; does not auto focus well, lcd is hard to see in daylight, battery life is very, very short, take a lot of extra batteries.I bought this Camera for my wife about a year ago. We do a lot of international traveling and wanted something light weight, yet reliable for her to carry around.(My wife is disabled and a large camera would not have worked as well for her.)  Most of her pictures come out blurry and out of focus. 6 out of 10 pictures need to be deleted. They ones that turn our good still lack depth for a 10MP camera. This one is going to the junk pile and I will be researching for a new camera for her to use.

Reviews.Title: Camera Great the software won't download
Reviews.Author: christy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Pentax Optio E60 Oct 19th. Pics are turning out great. Way better than my old Fuji digital.My software goes through the entire process to load buy when the computer reboots up.Nothing is there. I had to have to send it back over bad software. Anyone else have any problems like this they some light could be shed my way.Thanks[...]

Reviews.Title: Pentax 10.1 mp optio
Reviews.Author: Darwin E. Brightbill Jr. "Papa"
Reviews.Content: This a nice camera, however, the two AA batteries fade fast and spares need to be carried all the time.  For the price I believe I could have done better.  Thank You

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with my PINK Pentax!
Reviews.Author: Marion
Reviews.Content: I wasn't aware the memory card wasn't included, it allowed two photos without the card. The pictures came out great, the colors matched exactly.The software installation went well for me. Did you disable your virus protection and close all your programs prior to installation..????Their (Pentax) customer service is awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money you pay to buy this camera, it's pretty good. Sometimes the camera won't focus when in Flower mode, or recognize a person's face, and sometimes it doesn't turn on at all. But these problems are all relatively minor. It's a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very low battery life!
Reviews.Author: J. Mang "msaspen1"
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this camera because I wanted a pocket size camera to carry with me and did not want to carry my more expensive fuji digital.The menu is great, very simple, but the battery life is not very good at all.  With less than 100 pics, I have used four AA batteries already ,, in a very short amount of time.  All the features really use up the battery power.  Please keep this in mind when thinking about buying this camera.  You will need to carry AA batteries with you all the time.  When the batteries are low in power, this camera simply quits.  I have not had any photos developed yet, but if they are not of good quality, this camera will be returned.

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA EVER ! ! !
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: As a loyal and exclusive Pentax user since 1996, I thought this was a great buy.  I must have been drunk.  This camera is complete garbage.  Within 2 months of ownership, the lens froze and would not retract.  After getting it fixed, the LCD monitor now goes black whenever it wants to.  Oh yeah, and it takes horrible, grainy, noisy pictures.  The color tones are way off.  You would be better off chiseling a portait into an elephant tusk.  This camera is seriously a piece of junk.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.1-megapixel CCD for high-quality, poster-sized prints
3x wide-angle optical zoom lens; 2.4-inch LCD
Face Recognition AF and AE function automatically detects up to 10 faces in the picture frame
High Sensitivity Digital SR mode for reduced camera shake
Captures images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Pentax Optio E60 10.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
